item.title: Create a Static Blog with Hugo, PaperMod and Github Pages
item.description:
This article describes how I built this blog using the Hugo framework and the PaperMod theme; and how to host it on GitHub Pages. Unlike most tutorials, my approach stores the source code in a private GitHub repository while serving the site from a public GitHub Pages repository.

Hugo

Hugo is a popular open-source static website generator. Written in Go, it is very fast to build and serve. Like Jekyll, you can write the blog posts using Markdown and Hugo will natively render the markdown files to HTML pages. It supports many themes, including PaperMod, which is very flexible and pleasing to look at.
